---
slug: /132
title: "This Week In React #132: Astro, Remix, Server Components, useGlobalState, Next.js, Redwood, Expo Router, Expo Image, Android Widgets..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 01-25-2023
---
Hi everyone!
This week we have some nice releases with Astro 2.0 and Remix 1.11. Also some interesting content around Server Components.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons de belles sorties avec Astro 2.0 et Remix 1.11. Ainsi que du contenu int√©ressant autour des Server Components.
translations.en: Cette semaine, nous avons de belles sorties avec Astro 2.0 et Remix 1.11. Ainsi que du contenu int√©ressant autour des Server Components.

segments.source_content: React-Native is not left out with Expo Router in release candidate, Expo Image in beta, and a new solution to create Android widgets.

translations.fr: React-Native n'est pas en reste avec Expo Router en version candidate, Expo Image en b√™ta et une nouvelle solution pour cr√©er des widgets Android.
translations.en: React-Native n'est pas en reste avec Expo Router en version candidate, Expo Image en b√™ta, et une nouvelle solution pour cr√©er des widgets Android.

segments.source_content: I was invited to the show [Learn With Jason - Create and deploy a documentation website](https://www.learnwithjason.dev/create-and-deploy-a-documentation-website?utm_source=thisweekinreact) in which Jason makes his first steps on Docusaurus.

segments.source_content: Discover the [ES.next News newsletter](https://esnextnews.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact), a good source of information to keep up to date on the evolution of the JavaScript language, the TC39 committee and JS tooling like ESLint, Babel, Bun, Prettier...

translations.en: D√©couvrez la newsletter [ES.next News](https://esnextnews.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact), une bonne source d'information pour se tenir au courant de l'√©volution du langage JavaScript, du comit√© TC39 et des outils JS comme ESLint, Babel, Bun, Prettier...

## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![Astro 2.0](/emails/issues/132/astro2.jpg)](https://astro.build/blog/astro-2/)
**[Astro 2.0](https://astro.build/blog/astro-2/)**
Astro releases its v2. New features highlighted:

translations.fr: Astro publie sa version 2. Principales nouveaut√©s :
translations.en: Astro sort sa version 2. Les nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s mises en avant :

segments.source_content:
- Content Collections: Automatic type-safety for Markdown & MDX.
- Hybrid Rendering: Static? Dynamic? Get the best of both worlds.
- Redesigned Error Overlays
- Improved Dev Server (HMR)
- Vite 4.0
- Public Roadmap

translations.fr:
- Content Collections : S√©curit√© de type automatique pour Markdown et MDX
- Rend hybride : Statique ? Dynamique ? Le meilleur des deux mondes
- Superpositions d'erreur repens√©es
- Serveur de d√©veloppement am√©lior√© (HMR)
- Vite 4.0
- Feuille de route publique
translations.en:
- Content Collections : S√©curit√© de type automatique pour Markdown & MDX
- Rendu Hybride : Statique ? Dynamique ? Obtenez le meilleur des deux mondes
- Superpositions d'erreurs redessin√©es
- Serveur de d√©veloppement am√©lior√© (HMR)
- Vite 4.0
- Feuille de route publique

segments.source_content: See also the article [Introducing Content Collections: Type-Safe Markdown in Astro 2.0](https://astro.build/blog/introducing-content-collections/). It's about validating the front matter with Zod, to be able to use this data in a typed way in React components, and to have good error messages displayed with a good DX when front matter data that doesn't respect the schema. Definitely a good idea, by the way [Docusaurus does it too](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/4591) üòú.

translations.fr: Voir aussi l'article [Introducing Content Collections: Type-Safe Markdown in Astro 2.0](https://astro.build/blog/introducing-content-collections/). Il s'agit de valider les m√©tadonn√©es avec Zod pour utiliser ces donn√©es de mani√®re typ√©e dans les composants React, avec une excellente DX lors des erreurs de sch√©ma. Une excellente id√©e, d'ailleurs [Docusaurus le fait aussi](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/4591) üòú.
translations.en: Voir aussi l'article [Introducing Content Collections: Type-Safe Markdown in Astro 2.0](https://astro.build/blog/introducing-content-collections/). Il s'agit de valider le front matter avec Zod, pour pouvoir utiliser ces donn√©es de mani√®re typ√©e dans les composants React, et d'afficher de bons messages d'erreur avec une bonne DX lorsque les donn√©es du front matter ne respectent pas le sch√©ma. Une tr√®s bonne id√©e, d'ailleurs [Docusaurus le fait aussi](https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/4591) üòú.

segments.source_content: [![Remix 1.11](/emails/issues/132/remix0.11.jpg)](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.11.0)
**[Remix 1.11](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.11.0)**
A nice Remix release with the main new features:

translations.fr: Une belle version de Remix avec les principales nouveaut√©s :
translations.en: Une belle version de Remix avec les principales nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s :

segments.source_content:
- `defer` + `<Await>` to initiate a streamed response. The loader can return promises that will be awaited later on the client side.
- [Route Convention v2](https://remix.run/docs/en/v1/file-conventions/route-files-v2): a new convention (flat routes) that can be activated now and will become the default convention in v2.
- Experimental support for CSS imports, CSS Modules, Vanilla Extract.

translations.fr:
- `defer` + `<Await>` pour initier une r√©ponse stream√©e. Le chargeur peut renvoyer des promesses qui seront r√©solues c√¥t√© client ult√©rieurement.
- [Route Convention v2](https://remix.run/docs/en/v1/file-conventions/route-files-v2) : nouvelle convention (routes plates) activable d√®s maintenant et qui deviendra la convention par d√©faut en v2.
- Support exp√©rimental des imports CSS, CSS Modules et Vanilla Extract.
translations.en:
- `defer` + `<Await>` pour initier une r√©ponse stream√©e. Le loader peut retourner des promesses qui seront attendues ult√©rieurement c√¥t√© client.
- [Route Convention v2](https://remix.run/docs/en/v1/file-conventions/route-files-v2) : une nouvelle convention (routes plates) activable d√®s maintenant et qui deviendra la convention par d√©faut en v2.
- Support exp√©rimental pour les imports CSS, CSS Modules et Vanilla Extract.

segments.source_content:
- üìñ Beta docs: ["the main remaining blocker is the landing page which we‚Äôre working on now"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1617543301477060608)
- üê¶ ["If you use React, you should be using a React framework"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1617611126514266112): Andrew Clark gives good reasons to use a framework. If you don't use one, you end up creating a not-so-great one yourself.
- üìú [The building blocks of great docs](https://www.mux.com/blog/the-building-blocks-of-great-docs): migration in progress of a technical documentation to Next.js 13. The use of Server Components brings a lot of benefits on a site with lots of static content.
- üìú [useGlobalState - Sharing state between React components without context or fancy libraries](https://yoavik.com/snippets/use-global-state): proposes to create its own global state abstraction, without the need to use providers.
- üìú [What I Like About Astro](https://www.macarthur.me/posts/what-i-like-about-astro): interesting comparison with Gatsby or Next.js on data sourcing, integrations (RSS, sitemap...). Astro makes it difficult to have a slow site.
- üìú [Improving readability with React Wrap Balancer](https://vercel.com/blog/react-wrap-balancer): details the inner workings of React Wrap Balancer which allows to balance headlines without producing layout shifts (missing CSS feature).
- üìú [Things I want to see in JavaScript and Frontend development in 2023](https://paularmstrong.dev/blog/2023/01/20/javascript-and-frontend-things-to-see-in-2023/): interesting predictions and a hot criticism of React üî•
- üìú [Use Remix as a SPA only](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/use-remix-as-a-spa-only): using a `<ClientOnly>` component.
- üìú [Gatsby 5, TypeScript, and Generated GraphQL Types: A Walkthrough](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/blog/gatsby-5-typescript-and-generated-graphql-types-a-walkthrough/)
- üìú [Modals with React Router 6 and Remix](https://dev.to/infoxicator/modals-with-react-router-6-and-remix-1e35)
- üìú [Why React Router is excellent for Micro-Frontends](https://dev.to/infoxicator/why-react-router-is-excellent-for-micro-frontends-2a21)
- üìú [useAsyncEffect: The Missing React Hook](https://marmelab.com/blog/2023/01/11/use-async-effect-react.html)
- üìú [Test-driven development of NextJS API routes](https://massimilianomirra.com/notes/test-driven-development-of-nextjs-api-routes)
- üìú [How to build a better React map with Pigeon Maps and Mapbox](https://evilmartians.com/chronicles/how-to-build-a-better-react-map-with-pigeon-maps-and-mapbox)
- üìú [Refraction, dispersion, and other shader light effects](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/refraction-dispersion-and-other-shader-light-effects/)
- üßë‚Äçüéì [Josh Comeau - Joy of React - Couse launch](https://twitter.com/JoshWComeau/status/1617553220242661377)
- üé® [TanStack Query multi-client sync demo](https://twitter.com/aryan__deora/status/1616097346558754819)
- üé® [DevTools - Toggle Suspense boundaries demo](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1617205554547683328)
- üëÄ [Remix PR - add built-in PostCSS and Tailwind support](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/5229)
- üëÄ [XState PR - createProvider](https://twitter.com/DavidKPiano/status/1617537783018422273)
- üëÄ [React docs PR - Replace Create React App recommendation with Vite](https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/pull/5487): controversial PR this week
- üì¶ [Bright - React Server Component for syntax highlighting](https://github.com/code-hike/bright): promising WIP package for modern syntax highlighting. In a Node.js/server context, we can run heavier code like parsing an AST rather than using regexp (Prism).
- üì¶ [Redwood 4.0 RC](https://twitter.com/RedwoodJS/status/1616002999729389568): new API Auth, GraphQL Yoga v3, GraphQL Armor, Node.js 16/18...
- üì¶ [shadcdn/ui - Beautifully designed components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS](https://twitter.com/shadcn/status/1617916719242293248)
- üì¶ [next-mdx-remote 4.3 - Server Components Support (experimental)](https://github.com/hashicorp/next-mdx-remote/releases/tag/v4.3.0)
- üé• [Astro 2.0 is Revolutionary!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gi4c7fbeURc)
- üé• [Lee Robinson - Revisiting my React course 3 years later](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DQk0TWmgYXw)

## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
[![Expo Router RC](/emails/issues/132/expo-router.jpg)](https://blog.expo.dev/announcing-the-expo-router-v1-release-candidate-c5680b88a18c)
**[Expo Router v1 Release Candidate](https://blog.expo.dev/announcing-the-expo-router-v1-release-candidate-c5680b88a18c)**

Expo Router proposes to create your mobile navigation (still based on React-Navigation) using file-system naming conventions, as do most React web frameworks already. We can find the usual features like layout routes, dynamic routes, error boundaries...

translations.fr: Expo Router propose de cr√©er votre navigation mobile (toujours bas√©e sur React-Navigation) en utilisant des conventions de nommage de syst√®me de fichiers, comme le font d√©j√† la plupart des frameworks web React. On y retrouve les fonctionnalit√©s habituelles : routes de layout, routes dynamiques, limites d'erreur...
translations.en: Expo Router propose de cr√©er votre navigation mobile (toujours bas√©e sur React-Navigation) en utilisant des conventions de nommage de syst√®me de fichiers, comme le font d√©j√† la plupart des frameworks React web. On retrouve les fonctionnalit√©s habituelles : routes de mise en page, routes dynamiques, gestionnaires d'erreurs...

segments.source_content: The most interesting for me: the universal support. Navigation is based on links, a `<Link>` component and Metro web support (experimental). Now that the native part of Expo is working well, I wouldn't be surprised to see Expo gradually become a universal full-stack framework, and realize [Andrew Clark's prediction](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1489755769876754434).

translations.fr: Le plus int√©ressant pour moi : le support universel. La navigation est bas√©e sur des liens, un composant `<Link>` et le support web Metro (exp√©rimental). Maintenant que la partie native d'Expo fonctionne bien, je ne serais pas surpris de voir Expo devenir progressivement un framework full-stack universel, r√©alisant ainsi [la pr√©diction d'Andrew Clark](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1489755769876754434).
translations.en: Le plus int√©ressant pour moi : le support universel. La navigation est bas√©e sur des liens, un composant `<Link>` et le support web Metro (exp√©rimental). Maintenant que la partie native d'Expo fonctionne bien, je ne serais pas surpris de voir Expo devenir progressivement un framework full-stack universel, r√©alisant ainsi [la pr√©diction d'Andrew Clark](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1489755769876754434).

segments.source_content:
- üëÄ [Expo-Image in beta](https://twitter.com/JI/status/1616337848558551041): Expo's new image component goes into beta. Performant, cross-platform (web/mobile), many formats, placeholders, object-fit... Check the [doc](https://docs.expo.dev/versions/unversioned/sdk/image/).
- üìñ [Maestro Guides - React-Native](https://maestro.mobile.dev/platform-support/react-native): the e2e testing framework now offers a React-Native doc page.
- üì¶ [React-Native-Android-Widget](https://saleksovski.github.io/react-native-android-widget/): new package to create Android widgets, using dedicated UI primitives. Has a widget preview system. Easy to use in Expo (Config Plugin).
- üì¶ [Moti 0.22](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1616583066054545408): a fix brings Hermes support.
- üì¶ [Metro 0.74](https://github.com/facebook/metro/releases/tag/v0.74.0): great performance improvements.
- üéôÔ∏è [RNR 256 - Expo Router with Evan Bacon](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-256-expo-router-with-evan-bacon)

- üì¶ [React-Native-Android-Widget](https://saleksovski.github.io/react-native-android-widget/) : nouveau package pour cr√©er des widgets Android, utilisant des primitives UI d√©di√©es. Dispose d'un syst√®me de pr√©visualisation. Facile √† utiliser avec Expo (Config Plugin).
- üì¶ [Moti 0.22](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1616583066054545408) : un correctif apporte le support Hermes.
- üì¶ [Metro 0.74](https://github.com/facebook/metro/releases/tag/v0.74.0) : importantes am√©liorations de performances.

- üìñ [Guides Maestro - React-Native](https://maestro.mobile.dev/platform-support/react-native) : le framework de tests e2e propose d√©sormais une page doc d√©di√©e √† React-Native.
- üì¶ [React-Native-Android-Widget](https://saleksovski.github.io/react-native-android-widget/) : nouveau package pour cr√©er des widgets Android, utilisant des primitives UI d√©di√©es. Dispose d'un syst√®me de pr√©visualisation. Facile √† utiliser avec Expo (Config Plugin).
- üì¶ [Moti 0.22](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1616583066054545408) : un correctif ajoute le support Hermes.

We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
